actions.committee: Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works.

official_title: A bill to investigate the water and related resources of four Idaho river basins to determine ways to restore or improve the habitat of anadromous species of fish, and for other purposes.
short_title: Idaho Anadromous Fish Habitat Restoration Act

summary.text: Idaho Anadromous Fish Habitat Restoration Act - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior acting through the Commissioner of Reclamation to undertake appraisal-level investigations of the water and related resources of the following river drainages lying wholly or partially within the State of Idaho: (1) the Lemhi River basin; (2) the Pahsimeroi River basin; (3) the Potlatch River basin; and (4) the Palouse River basin. Declares that the objective of each investigation shall be to: (1) identify where environmental improvements could be made or water storage facilities constructed within each basin to restore or improve the habitat of anadromous species of fish; and (2) identify secondary opportunities within each basin, including the improvement of agriculture, municipal, and industrial water supplies. Requires the Secretary to submit a report of the findings and recommendations from each investigation to the appropriate Congressional committees on or before September 30, 1983.

titles.title: Idaho Anadromous Fish Habitat Restoration Act
A bill to investigate the water and related resources of four Idaho river basins to determine ways to restore or improve the habitat of anadromous species of fish, and for other purposes.
